0.title: Mumbai witnesses nearly 70% of average July rainfall in 5 days
0.article_body: Amid heavy rains, Mumbai witnessed 69.41% (594 mm) of the average July rainfall (855.7 mm) in the first five days of the month, as per India Meteorological Department (IMD) data. "Due to active monsoon conditions, rainfall activity over Konkan and adjoining ghat areas of Madhya Maharashtra is expected to increase in the next four to five days," IMD stated.

1.title: 3 Khans won't come on 'Koffee..'; I've no power, doomed by reputation: Karan
1.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said the three Khans will not be coming on the latest season of 'Koffee With Karan'. "I am doomed by the reputation...of my show," he said, adding, "I don't have...power to pull them [three Khans]. I can get them for a party but not on my show. I can't manage two also out of the three Khans."

2.title: 50-yr-old man rapes & impregnates 16-yr-old neighbour in Mumbai; arrested
2.article_body: A 50-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping his 16-year-old neighbour in Mumbai.  The accused reportedly asked the girl to help him move when he shifted to a new house. Later, he accused her of stealing things from his house and raped her before letting her go home, police said. The matter came to light when the girl became pregnant.

3.title: Cried when Nadal lost vs Djokovic in French Open 2021: Iga Świątek
3.article_body: World number one women's tennis player Iga Świątek said she "cried" after Rafael Nadal's loss against Novak Djokovic in the semi-final of French Open 2021. "Nadal has always been my idol," added Świątek. Talking about picking between singer Adele and Nadal, Świątek stated on Twitter, "I would need to listen to Rafa singing and see Adele playing tennis."

4.title: TMC should expel Moitra if they don't endorse her remark: BJP's Sukanta
4.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar said that TMC can't detach itself from Mahua Moitra's remark on goddess Kaali. "If TMC actually doesn't endorse it, they should take action and they should either expel her or suspend her from the party for a few days," Majumdar said. On Tuesday, TMC condemned Moitra's "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess" remark.

5.title: Jadeja bowls too flat, India missed a quality spinner: Lloyd on 5th Test
5.article_body: Ex-England cricketer David Lloyd said India were "hamstrung" by not having a quality spinner in the fifth Test against England which they lost by seven wickets, having not picked Ravichandran Ashwin. "[Ravindra Jadeja] tends to bowl too flat and...quick," added Lloyd. "Loop drift and spin bring dividends...Ashwin has it but India played safe-to their cost," he stated.

6.title: US pushes ASML to stop selling chipmaking gear to China: Report
6.article_body: The US is pushing semiconductor manufacturing equipment provider ASML to stop selling any more of its gear to Chinese chipmakers, Bloomberg reported. It's seeking to expand an existing moratorium on advanced chipmaking systems' sales to Chinese firms. "The discussion is not new. No decisions have been made, and we do not want to speculate or comment on rumours," ASML said.

7.title: Canada becomes 1st country to ratify Finland, Sweden's bids to join NATO
7.article_body: Canada became the first country to formally ratify Sweden and Finland's requests to join NATO after member nations signed off on the accession protocols on Tuesday. Parliaments of all 30 NATO members must ratify Finland and Sweden's bids before they can be protected by the NATO defence clause, which states an attack on one ally is an attack against all.

8.title: Instagram Direct down for many users across the globe for over 12 hours
8.article_body: Instagram Direct has been down for many users across the globe for over 12 hours, with users saying they have been unable to send messages. A user took to Twitter and wrote, "Why isn't there any statement on when the issue is going to get resolved?" "It's been 12 hours! How much time it'd need to restore," another user tweeted.

9.title: Important for Team India to have stable captain: Deep Dasgupta
9.article_body: After England levelled the five-match Test series 2-2 with a seven-wicket win over India, former India cricketer Deep Dasgupta said it's important to have a stable captain. "In the last few months...due to injury and other reasons, we had to shuffle between captains," he added. Notably, India captain Rohit Sharma has returned to the squad for England T20Is.

10.title: Biggest proof of honesty: Kejriwal on CAG report showing Delhi govt in profit
10.article_body: Speaking about the CAG report which stated that the Delhi government was running in profit, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said that the numbers were the "biggest proof of its honesty". "This honesty has deprived our opponents of their sleep," Kejriwal added. The CAG report indicated that Delhi government's revenue receipts were sufficient to meet the revenue expenditure.

11.title: YSRCP MLA from Nellore enters drain to protest against sewage issues
11.article_body: YSRCP MLA from Nellore, Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy, protested against the officials for not resolving sewage issues in Umma Reddy Gunta by entering into sewage water on Tuesday. He said officials didn't listen to him despite several requests. He demanded the officials to give him in writing, a proper time frame for the work to be completed.

12.title: Hyderabad woman cheated of ₹39 lakh in 'KBC lottery’ fraud
12.article_body: Cyber fraudsters reportedly cheated a woman from Hyderabad of ₹39 lakh. They called her and said she has won 'KBC lottery' and made her pay ₹39 lakh fees as a part of the withdrawal process. When she realised she was cheated, the woman lodged a complaint. Police tracked the accused and arrested a man involved in the fraud from Patna.

13.title: British & their habit of distorting history: Mishra on Barmy Army's 'Eng win series' pic
13.article_body: Veteran leg-spinner Amit Mishra took to Twitter to criticise England's Barmy Army after they posted a picture that read, "England win series 1-0", following the fifth Test at Edgbaston. "Haash! British and their habit of distorting history for their own advantage," Mishra wrote. The series ended 2-2, with India having earlier taken a 2-1 lead after the first four matches.

14.title: US Independence Day parade shooter was dressed as a woman; pic surfaces
14.article_body: The shooter, who killed seven people at an Independence Day parade in US, dressed as a woman so that he could escape the scene of the mass shooting. Robert Crimo was arrested on Monday evening following an eight-hour manhunt and was charged with seven counts of first-degree murder on Tuesday. He was carrying an AR-15-style rifle.

15.title: I'd rather do films I'm proud of, okay if they don't make ₹100 cr: Rajkummar
15.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao said that it is okay if his films do not make ₹100 crore at the box office. "I [would] rather do films I can be proud of and not necessarily something that is working. As long as my producers don't lose money, I can keep telling stories...I don't want to be part of a herd," he added.

16.title: Man electrocuted to death in Kolkata; 3rd such incident in past 2 weeks
16.article_body: A 35-year-old man was electrocuted to death in Kolkata's Tangra area on Tuesday. According to reports, a minor fire broke out at Bunty Haldar's shop at around 9 am. However, when he tried to pull down the shop's iron shutter, he was electrocuted, police said. Notably, this is the third such incident in Kolkata in the past two weeks.

17.title: Bar body urges CJI to reject plea against SC remarks on Nupur
17.article_body: All India Bar Association wrote to CJI NV Ramana asking him to reject a letter petition seeking removal of Supreme Court’s recent remarks against suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma. “While engaging with counsel, it is natural for judges to open up and make observations and suggestions,” said AIBA. This comes after several former judges and bureaucrats condemned the court's remarks.

18.title: RBI to release Code of Conduct for digital lending by July-end: Report
18.article_body: The Reserve Bank of India will release the Code of Conduct for digital lending by the end of this month, ET Now reported citing sources. The guidelines will be applicable to all regulated entities including NBFCs and banks. Consumer consent will become mandatory for using data collected from users, the report added.

19.title: We're not doing anything illegal, ours is strong govt: Maha CM Shinde
19.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Wednesday said, "We are not doing anything illegal." "There are rules, laws and Constitution and we've to work according to them," he added. Furthermore, he said, "Today, we've more than a 2/3rd majority, so our decision is legal." Shinde added, his government has the support of 170 MLAs and it’s a strong government.

20.title: Woman killed in landslide in Shimla, 4 feared washed away after flash flood in Kullu
20.article_body: A landslide on the outskirts of Shimla city left a woman dead and two others critically injured, an official said. At least four people were feared washed away in a flash flood triggered by a cloud burst in Himachal Pradesh's Kullu district. Following the cloud burst at Chojh village at around 6 am, four to six people were missing.

21.title: Will not share US user data with China if asked: TikTok
21.article_body: TikTok in response to two US senators seeking an FTC probe into it due to "repeated misrepresentations" over its handling of US data, said, "TikTok has never shared US user data with the Chinese government, nor would we if asked." The senators' request followed a BuzzFeed report saying TikTok engineers and executives in China repeatedly access US users' private data.

22.title: Hyderabad civic body to build more than 35,000 2BHKs by March 2023
22.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) has decided to complete the construction of 35,444 2BHKs by March 2023 under the Telangana government's double-bedroom housing scheme. Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao has instructed officials to formulate an action plan within a week for the distribution of the houses. Notably, the construction of 64,556 units has already been completed.

23.title: Mumbai man who abused police for waking him gets 1.7 yrs in jail
23.article_body: A  27-year-old labourer who abused a police constable when woken up at Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus' platform was sentenced to one year and seven months' imprisonment by a sessions court. Refusing to leave the platform, Panvel resident Rameshwar Rathoda abused the police and said, "Does this platform belong to your father...I will sleep here if I want to...Do whatever you want."

24.title: HC dismisses plea over property acquisition filed after delay of 62 yrs
24.article_body: Delhi HC dismissed a plea in connection with acquisition of property in Kalu Sarai after noting it was filed after a delay of 62 years. The plea sought dismissal of notifications of 1959 and 1960 issued under Land Acquisition Act, 1894. "Petitioners accepted...enhanced compensation without reserving any right...the law doesn't permit...to approbate and reprobate at the same time," HC said.

25.title: Suspect in US parade shooting charged with 7 counts of murder
25.article_body: A 21-year-old man accused of opening fire on US Independence Day parade in a Chicago suburb has been charged with seven counts of murder. The first-degree murder charges would be followed by "dozens of more charges", Lake County State Attorney Eric Rinehart said. The accused, who'd reportedly fired 70 rounds into the crowd, planned the attack for weeks, police said.

26.title: PM Modi calls up Tejashwi Yadav to enquire about Lalu Prasad Yadav's health
26.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi spoke to Rashtriya Janata Dal leader Tejashwi Yadav to enquire about health of RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who fractured his shoulder after falling off stairs on Sunday. "The PM spoke to Tejashwi Yadav on Tuesday and enquired about the health of the RJD supremo. PM wished speedy recovery to RJD chief," RJD spokesperson (Bihar), said.

27.title: BJP filled with terrorists, it's top 2 afraid of AAP: Kejriwal
27.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal called BJP a party "filled with gundas, hooligans, rapists and terrorists". He noted that a terrorist recently arrested in Jammu and Kashmir was a "senior leader". "If you google 'rapist in BJP', you will find a long list of BJP leaders," he said. He also said that BJP's top two leaders are afraid of AAP.

28.title: Edtech startup AntWalk secures $7.5 million funding in Series A round
28.article_body: Bengaluru-based B2B edtech startup AntWalk has secured $7.5 million funding in a Series A round led by San Francisco-based venture capital firm GSV Ventures. Y Combinator and existing investor Matrix Partners India also participated in the round. The startup, which was founded in 2019, will use the newly-acquired funding to expand its customer base, among other things.

29.title: 5 Assamese-speaking Muslim groups get indigenous status in Assam
29.article_body: Assam cabinet granted indigenous status to five Assamese-speaking Muslim communities. "They are Goria, Moriya, Deshi, Julah and Syed...they will be categorised as Assamese Muslim sub-groups or indigenous Assamese Muslims," state Health Minister Keshab Mahanta said. This will ensure their development in health, education, skill development and women empowerment, CM Himanta Biswa Sarma said.

30.title: Not Bazball, it's what they normally do: Hussain on Root-Bairstow's stand
30.article_body: Talking about the unbeaten 269-run partnership between Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow in England's second innings of the fifth Test against India, ex-England captain Nasser Hussain said, "It's not really Bazball." "The way they...[played] is...what normal Root and Bairstow can do," added Hussain. Root scored an unbeaten 142 with Bairstow remaining unbeaten on 114, as England won by seven wickets.

31.title: India sees 16,159 new COVID-19 cases, 28 deaths; state-wise list of active cases released
31.article_body: India has reported 16,159 new COVID-19 cases and 28 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. India's active caseload stands at 1,15,212, with the maximum active cases in Kerala (29,155), followed by Maharashtra (20,820) and Tamil Nadu (16,765). India's COVID-19 death toll reached 5,25,270.

32.title: Part of me wanted India to get to 450 to see what we'd do: Stokes
32.article_body: After England recorded their highest-ever successful Test chase (378 runs), England captain Ben Stokes said he wanted India to set a target of 450 runs to see what they would do. "We knew we were always going to go out and try and chase that down," he added. England's Joe Root and Jonny Bairstow scored centuries in the fourth innings.

33.title: Female model from Brazil killed while fighting against Russia in Ukraine
33.article_body: A female model from Brazil, who received sniper training, has been killed while fighting against Russia in Ukraine. Thalita do Valle, who was killed in a Russian missile strike, took part in humanitarian missions around the world and had previously fought against ISIS in Iraq. The 39-year-old's brother described her as a hero.

34.title: England Cricket, Barmy Army troll Kohli after England's record run chase against India
34.article_body: England Cricket and Barmy Army trolled Virat Kohli after England recorded their highest successful Test run chase against India. England Cricket shared a picture of Kohli sledging Jonny Bairstow and a picture of seemingly disappointed Kohli embracing Bairstow after India's defeat. Barmy Army tweeted, "Bairstow has scored more runs in...last 25 days than Kohli has in the last 18 months."

35.title: I train everyday to play matches of this calibre: Jannik after match vs Djokovic
35.article_body: World number 13 Jannik Sinner, who had gone two sets up before losing to Novak Djokovic in their Wimbledon 2022 quarter-final, has said he's happy with his performance in the tournament. "I train every day to play matches of this calibre. I know I still have a lot to improve...[but] I think...I showed a good level of tennis," he stated.

36.title: Fewer judges, absence of infra increasing pendency of cases: CJI
36.article_body: Chief Justice of India (CJI) NV Ramana said that pendency of cases is "intensifying" in India due to absence of adequate infrastructure and sufficient number of judges with the increasing workload. He said that he has been reminding the government to expedite the process of filling up vacancies. "I am hoping for some forward movement in this regard," he added.

37.title: Canada to throw out 1.36 crore AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine doses
37.article_body: Canada will throw out around 1.36 crore doses of the Oxford-AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine that have expired. "Due to limited demand for the vaccine and recipient country challenges with distribution and absorption, they were not accepted," said Health Canada in a statement. The country had procured 2 crore doses from AstraZeneca, but later focused on using Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines.

38.title: Aamir is not Punjabi, could have done better with accent in 'Laal...': Sargun
38.article_body: Actress Sargun Mehta said actor Aamir Khan is not Punjabi and he could have done better with Punjabi accent in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Whatever he has done in the film, it takes a lot to get the results. He has...worked really hard," she said, adding, "If Aamir would have [used] pure Punjabi...nobody could have understood."

39.title: We'll fight for it, protest & go to court: AIMIM leader on renaming of Aurangabad
39.article_body: Days after Maharashtra Cabinet approved renaming of Aurangabad to Sambhaji Nagar, AIMIM leader Imtiaz Jaleel on Tuesday said the residents, whichever religion they may be from, feel connected to the name. "No one wants the name to change. We'll fight for it in any way possible...stage protests, go to court and raise our voice in Parliament," he added.

40.title: TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan granted bail over misleading video on Rahul Gandhi
40.article_body: TV news anchor Rohit Ranjan, who was arrested by Noida Police on Tuesday over misleading clips on Congress leader Rahul Gandhi, was released on bail. He was released on bail as the sections against him are bailable offences, police said. Ranjan had purportedly misquoted Gandhi's statements on vandalism at his Wayanad office and linked it to the Udaipur tailor's murder.

41.title: Ajmer Dargah Khadim offers his house to anyone who beheads Nupur Sharma, arrested
41.article_body: Salman Chishti, Khadim of Ajmer Dargah, who announced to give away his house and property in a video to reward anyone who beheads former BJP spokesperson Nupur Sharma for her comments against the Prophet has been arrested. Police said that Salman Chishti is a history-sheeter and it was found that he made the video in an inebriated state.

42.title: Russia passes bill for stricter fines on foreign tech firms with no office
42.article_body: Russian lawmakers have passed a bill for stricter penalties for foreign internet companies that fail to open an office in Russia, including fines. Last year, Russian communications regulator Roskomnadzor listed 13 companies, mostly based in the US, required to set up offices by the end of the year. Russia has recently acted against several tech firms, including Meta and Twitter.

43.title: BJP supported us for our 'Hindutva position', development agenda: Maha CM
43.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has said that the Shiv Sena MLAs who revolted against Uddhav Thackeray's government had taken a "Hindutva position". Shinde said BJP supported them for their Hindutva and agenda of development. "And they (BJP) supported us despite having more numbers, more MLAs," Shinde told ANI, adding that Devendra Fadnavis became Deputy Chief Minister showing a "big heart".

44.title: Eknath Shinde backstabbed me: Former Maha CM Uddhav Thackeray
44.article_body: Former Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray on Tuesday said Eknath Shinde, who led the rebellion with party MLAs to bring down Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government, backstabbed him. "Shinde to whom I have given the responsibility of the party backstabbed me," Thackeray said. "It's painful to see...those who won due to Sena workers and got everything have left," he added.

45.title: BJP planning to convert Delhi into full UT, scrap polls: Kejriwal
45.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said there are "talks" that the Centre may dissolve Delhi Assembly and convert Delhi into a full Union Territory (UT). "The BJP leaders are now threatening that there will be no next election in Delhi...by making Delhi a full Union Territory (UT)," Kejriwal said. "By hating Kejriwal, you've started hating the country," he added.

46.title: Skills can take you places: Scaler
46.article_body: Edtech startup, Scaler, highlights the importance of building real skills to take a leap in one's tech career. A structured curriculum, taught by industry experts, prepares engineers for tech roles at top companies, said Scaler. Learners get solid career advice on how to create an impact in the tech world, from mentors who've been there, it added.

47.title: UK signs 1st international data sharing deal post Brexit
47.article_body: UK has entered into an agreement with South Korea under which organisations of both the countries will be able to share data across the borders without restrictions, the government said. This is UK's first international data adequacy agreement post Brexit. UK Data Minister Julia Lopez said, "[It] will enable more vital research that can improve the lives of people."

48.title: 15-year-old missing boy found murdered in Pune; 3 minors arrested
48.article_body: A 15-year-old boy was found murdered on Tuesday in Pune, a day after he went missing. As per police, the victim and five other minors had gathered in Moshi for a party on Monday. During the party, they'd heated arguments which allegedly led to the murder. Three minors have been arrested and they've confessed to the killing, the police said.

49.title: Man who said 'Jesus is supreme' gets death sentence for blasphemy in Pak
49.article_body: A Christian mechanic who said, "Jesus is supreme" during an argument with a customer was handed a death sentence in Pakistan. The man, Ashfaq Masih, was booked and arrested in 2017 after he refused to give a discount to the customer for his services. The crowd, which gathered after the argument broke out, accused Masih of disrespecting Prophet Muhammad.

50.title: When will you ask police to issue lookout notice for Mahua?: BJP MLA to Mamata
50.article_body: Following TMC's Mahua Moitra's remark that to her, "Kaali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting goddess", BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari asked, "Honourable CM Mamata Banerjee, when will you ask Kolkata Police to issue lookout notice for Mahua Moitra for insulting goddess maa Kaali?" "Why do you and your party leaders reserve all the abusive remarks for Hindu deities?" he asked.

51.title: E-challan helps Mumbai woman find bag she left in autorickshaw
51.article_body: A 61-year-old Mumbai-based woman, who left a bag containing valuables worth ₹5 lakh in an autorickshaw, found it back with help of e-challan. She got off at her destination in hurry due to heavy rain. Realising that she left the bag in autorickshaw she rushed to RCF Police Station where the police detected the vehicle number with help of e-challan.

52.title: Reports claim Dhaakad producer sold office to repay loans, he says 'Absolutely wrong'
52.article_body: Kangana Ranaut-starrer Dhaakad's producer Deepak Mukut has rubbished reports that claimed that he sold his office to repay dues and loans because the film failed at the box office. Mukut clarified, "These are baseless rumours and absolutely wrong. I have already recovered maximum loss and whatever is left will be recovered in the due course."

53.title: Difficult for Vihari, Sarfaraz is waiting: Jaffer on changes in Test squad
53.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has called for Ranji Trophy 2022 top-scorer Sarfaraz Khan's inclusion in India's Test squad in place of Hanuma Vihari, who scored a total of 31 runs in the rescheduled fifth Test against England. "Sarfaraz has been in really good form in the Ranji Trophy and should be given an opportunity," stated Jaffer.

54.title: Domestic LPG cylinder rate increased by ₹50 from today
54.article_body: The price of a 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder has been increased by ₹50 with effect from Wednesday, July 6. A domestic LPG cylinder will now cost ₹1,053 in Delhi and ₹1,052.50 in Mumbai. The price of a 5-kg domestic cylinder was also increased by ₹18, however, the price of a 19-kg commercial cylinder was cut by ₹8.50.

55.title: Nadhim Zahawi made UK Finance Minister after Rishi Sunak resigns
55.article_body: Nadhim Zahawi has been appointed as UK Finance Minister after Rishi Sunak resigned from the post. Sunak said that his approach to running the economy was "fundamentally too different" from PM Boris Johnson's. Meanwhile, Steve Barclay has been appointed Health Secretary after resignation of Sajid Javid, who said he had lost confidence in Johnson's ability to govern in national interest.

56.title: Transported to 1947, couldn't believe we recreated Partition: 'Ms..' director
56.article_body: 'Ms Marvel' director Sharmeen Obaid-Chinoy said that there were close to 1,000 extras on the set in the scene about the 1947 Partition. "There was a moment when all of us on set couldn't believe that we were able to recreate Partition...For that time we were filming her walking through that platform, we...really were transported into 1947," she added.

57.title: Relationships in Bollywood are 'very seasonal': Karan Johar
57.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar said relationships in Bollywood are "very seasonal" based on work commitments, adding that people fall off the radar but want to jump back "very conveniently". "I don't believe in seasonal relationships," he stated. Talking about his show 'Koffee with Karan', Karan said there were times when he was "perplexed" and "shocked" about his guests being very boring.

58.title: Justify decision to register Binance unit: French MEP to regulator
58.article_body: French MEP Aurore Lalucq has asked the market regulator to justify its "incomprehensible" decision to register a Binance unit as a digital assets service provider. Lalucq cited a Reuters investigation into money laundering on the platform as a basis for her concerns. She also mentioned Britain's financial regulator said Binance was "not capable of being effectively supervised".

59.title: Laid-off Tesla US workers file plea, allege small severance pay
59.article_body: Two laid-off Tesla US workers have filed an emergency motion alleging far less severance than legally required. The workers were among more than 500 workers laid off in Nevada. The motion stated that Tesla has been asking employees to agree to release it of all claims, in exchange for severance of just one or two weeks' pay and benefits.

60.title: 35-yr-old religious leader from Afghanistan shot dead in Nashik
60.article_body: A 35-year-old religious leader from Afghanistan was shot dead in the Yeola town of Maharashtra's Nashik on Tuesday, said police. A group of four unidentified persons carried out the deed, the motive of which was not immediately known, at an open plot. The victim, identified as Khwaja Sayyad Chishti, was popularly known as 'Sufi Baba' in the town.

61.title: NIA questions Bihar man in Hyderabad over Udaipur tailor's murder
61.article_body: National Investigation Agency (NIA) on Tuesday questioned a 36-year-old man from Bihar living in Hyderabad's Kalandar Nagar in connection with beheading of a tailor, Kanhaiya Lal, in Rajasthan's Udaipur. The man was reportedly served a notice by NIA to appear for enquiry in Jaipur on July 14. Lal was murdered by two men for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma.

62.title: 2-yr-old boy found wandering alone at US shooting site after both parents killed
62.article_body: A two-year-old boy was found wandering alone after the mass shooting at a US Independence Day parade in Chicago. The parents of the child named Aiden McCarthy were among seven people killed in the massacre, police officials said. The child's image from the shooting site surfaced on social media before police handed him over to his grandparents.

63.title: We have to reflect why we aren't able to bat well in 3rd innings: Dravid
63.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid has said they will review the failure of batters in the third innings of recent overseas Test matches. "We have to reflect why we aren't able to bat well in the third innings...and why we aren't able to take 10 wickets in the fourth innings," he stated. India have lost their last three overseas Tests.

64.title: 4 held for killing 17-yr-old boy, burying body in Delhi's Central Ridge
64.article_body: At least four men were arrested for allegedly kidnapping a 17-year-old boy, stabbing him to death and burying his body in Delhi's Central Ridge, police said. The accused burned the victim's and their own clothes to avoid identification and arrest, police added. The victim and his friends had allegedly assaulted one of the four accused on June 29, police stated.

65.title: Won't do sports films as I'm almost forgetting I'm an actor: Taapsee
65.article_body: Taapsee Pannu said she has decided not to act in sports films because she is almost forgetting that she is an actress. "[I've] done so many back-to-back sports films...People keep approaching me for sports biopics," added Taapsee. Taapsee will be next seen in her upcoming film 'Shabaash Mithu' which is a biopic on ex-Indian women's cricket team captain Mithali Raj.

66.title: Cell therapy cancer treatment facility being set up in B'luru, trials on
66.article_body: A cell therapy facility for cancer treatment is being set up in Mazumdar Shaw Medical Centre at Narayana Hrudayalaya Health City in Bengaluru. The team working on it is reportedly trying to bring down cost of the therapy from the current $4,00,000 to $3,50,000. "The clinical trial has already started, and we have dosed several patients," Dr Siddhartha Mukherjee said.

67.title: Delhi to get moderate rainfall on Thursday, 'orange' alert issued
67.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an 'orange' alert in Delhi for Thursday with the possibility of moderate rainfall. Thursday's rainfall is expected to bring a drop in the maximum temperature by three to four degrees, IMD scientist RK Jenamani said. According to IMD's seven-day forecast, Delhi has a 'yellow' alert for rainfall activity each day till July 11.

68.title: Worker kidnaps employer’s son over non-payment of wages; arrested in Thane
68.article_body: Panvel Police arrested a 35-year-old labourer from Thane's Bhiwandi for allegedly kidnapping his employer's 11-year-old son over non-payment of his wages of ₹8,000. The accused had reportedly demanded a ransom of ₹30,000 from his employer. "With [him], I had an understanding that after...completion of the work, I would pay his wages...Yet, he decided to abduct my son," the employer said.

69.title: B'luru reports 775 new COVID-19 cases; active cases stand at 5,988
69.article_body: Bengaluru reported 775 new COVID-19 cases on Tuesday, taking the number of active cases in the city to 5,988, according to Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike figures. No new coronavirus-related deaths were reported in Bengaluru in the last 24 hours and the positivity rate is at 5.08%, the data showed. The number of active clusters in the city is currently 28.

70.title: Potential Omicron sub-variant of COVID-19 reported from India & 10 countries: WHO
70.article_body: There has been an emergence of a potential Omicron sub-variant referred to as BA.2.75, first reported from India and then from 10 other countries, said the WHO. This sub-variant seems to have a few mutations on the receptor-binding domain of the spike protein, the WHO added. It's too early to know if this sub-variant is clinically more severe, it added.

71.title: What is the new cricketing term 'Bazball'?
71.article_body: The term 'Bazball' is named after England head coach Brendon McCullum. It essentially means an aggressive approach towards scoring quick runs even in Test cricket. 'Bazball' is designed to entertain and try to win matches and not draw them. England chased down targets of 277, 299 and 296 in 78.5, 50 and 54.2 overs, respectively against New Zealand.

72.title: I don't know what it is: Rahul Dravid as reporter asks 'What is your take on Bazball?'
72.article_body: After a reporter asked him about his take on 'Bazball', Team India head coach Rahul Dravid said, "I don't know what it is." Further talking about England's approach in Test cricket, Dravid said, "I'd definitely say the kind of cricket they have been playing in the last few months has been really good. They have been really good at chasing."

73.title: IAF gets 7.5 lakh applications under Agnipath, closes registration
73.article_body: The Indian Air Force (IAF) said it has received nearly 7.5 lakh applications for recruitment under the Agnipath scheme. The registrations, which started on June 24, were closed on Tuesday. "Compared to 6,31,528 applications in the past, which was the highest in any recruitment cycle, this time 7,49,899 applications have been received," said IAF.

74.title: Ola may lay off 400-500 employees to cut costs: Report
74.article_body: Ola is looking at cutting its costs which could result in it laying off around 400-500 employees, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. "Key managers were asked to draw up a list of people from their respective teams last week who can be let go," a source was quoted as saying. It has also stopped investments in overseas markets where it's present.

75.title: 5th electric bus depot started in Pune, 28 charging points operational
75.article_body: The Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) has started its fifth e-depot for charging and maintenance of e-buses in the city. The new depot has been started at the Pune Railway Station. Reports said that 25 buses will be charged at this e-depot in the first phase and that 28 charging points are already operational.

76.title: 892 prisoners released on parole across Maha during COVID didn’t return
76.article_body: As many as 892 prisoners of the 4,241 convicts lodged across 46 prisons in Maharashtra, who were released on COVID emergency parole, have reportedly not returned to jail. Many of these prisoners have been convicted of various serious crimes, like murder, attempt to murder etc. Prison department has lodged 86 FIRs against such absconding criminals and police are hunting them.

77.title: Canada museum apologises after India's statement on poster showing goddess Kali smoking
77.article_body: After Indian High Commission in Canada's statement on poster showing goddess Kali smoking, the Aga Khan Museum on Tuesday apologised. "The museum deeply regrets that one of the 18 short videos from 'Under the Tent' and its accompanying social media post have inadvertently caused offence to members of the Hindu and other faith communities," the museum's statement read.

78.title: 2 men drown in water-filled quarry in Mumbai's Dahisar, 1 body recovered
78.article_body: Two men drowned in a water-filled quarry in Mumbai's Dahisar on Tuesday evening. While the body of a 19-year-old youth has been found and identified, the authorities are still searching for the other person. According to police, a group of seven young men had entered the quarry at around 5:30 pm on Tuesday when the two of them drowned.

79.title: PMC yet to recover ₹9.20 cr fine for 92,126 illegal hoardings across Pune
79.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation is yet to recover ₹9.20 crore fine from violators for putting up illegal banners and hoardings across city from April 1, 2021 to June 30, 2022. Officials said fine for 92,126 boards has not been collected. PMC can, according to BPMC Act, recover ₹50,000 from an illegal advertisement board and impose fine of ₹5,000 per illegal hoarding.

80.title: 6-year-old boy falls into water-filled lift duct in Thane, dies
80.article_body: A six-year-old boy died after falling into a water-filled lift duct in an under-construction building in Thane's Dombivali on Tuesday, a police official said. The boy, identified as Vedant Jadhav, had gone missing at around 11:30 am. An investigation revealed that he fell into the duct while trying to retrieve the ball with which he was playing, the official added.

81.title: Nanded-Pune Daily Express train commences operation
81.article_body: The South Central Railway's Nanded-Pune Daily Express train has commenced operations. Raosaheb Patil Danve, Minister of State of Railways and Coal and Mines, flagged off the inaugural service from Jalna railway station on July 4. The train, which will start and terminate in Pune, will cover a distance of approximately 650 km in 14 hours and have 11 stoppages.

82.title: Iran has added unrelated demands for nuclear deal: US Special Envoy
82.article_body: Iran has added demands that have "nothing to do with the nuclear deal", US envoy appointed to revive the 2015 nuclear deal said. Special envoy Robert Malley also said that Iran has made significant progress in Uranium enrichment. Iran was offered relaxations in sanctions if it returned into compliance of the 2015 deal within a provided timeline, he added.

83.title: BharatPe disburses over ₹3,600 crore loans in Q1 FY23, up 112% QoQ
83.article_body: BharatPe on Tuesday said it disbursed over ₹3,600 crore loans to more than 1.2 lakh merchants in Q1 FY23. While disbursements recorded 112% quarter-on-quarter growth, the merchant beneficiary count grew nearly 82% from the January-March quarter, it stated. BharatPe also said that its annualised total payment value (TPV) hit an all-time high of $18.5 billion, an over 50% QoQ rise.

84.title: Complete pending tasks to decongest 77 traffic corridors: Delhi LG
84.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena has told all concerned agencies to complete their pending tasks so as to decongest 77 traffic corridors and improve traffic flow in the national capital. Agencies including the PWD and DDA have been given three months to complete all the pending work. The LG also asked the Chief Secretary to sort all pending departmental issues.

85.title: Chargesheet filed against suspended IAS officer in MNREGA scam
85.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has filed a chargesheet against suspended IAS officer Pooja Singhal who was arrested for allegedly embezzling MGNREGA funds in Khunti district of Jharkhand. Singhal was arrested on May 11 and her bail hearing is on July 12. The ED has reportedly recovered nearly ₹20 crore from Singhal.

86.title: China sees record rain, extreme heat in June
86.article_body: China is witnessing extreme weather patterns, recording above average rain and heat levels in the same month. This year, northeastern provinces received their highest-ever rainfall recorded in June. The national rainfall average for June was 112.1 mm, 9.1% higher than last year. Contrastingly, the average temperature nationwide was 21.3°C this month, 0.9°C higher than the same period last year.

87.title: India, Iran discuss Chabahar Port progress, situation in Afghanistan
87.article_body: India's Foreign Secretary Vinay Kwatra and Iran's Deputy PM for Political Affairs Dr Ali Bagheri Kani held a telephonic discussion on Tuesday and reviewed the progress of the Chabahar Port. The two sides also discussed the situation in Afghanistan and deliberated on other regional and global issues. Various elements of the India-Iran bilateral relations were discussed, the MEA said.

88.title: Mithun Chakraborty should apologise to Mamata Banerjee: TMC leader
88.article_body: TMC leader Kunal Ghosh criticised actor and BJP leader Mithun Chakraborty and asked him to apologise to West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. "When Didi nominated him for Rajya Sabha, he said that he will never forget the gesture of Mamata Banerjee. Then he...backstabbed Didi," Ghosh said. Ghosh's comment came after the BJP leader's visit to Kolkata after a year.

89.title: 25-yr-old Army jawan drowns while bathing in river Ganga in U'khand
89.article_body: Police said that a 25-year-old Army jawan, Nitul Yadav, drowned while bathing in river Ganga near Uttarakhand's Rishikesh on Tuesday. Yadav was part of a group of six members who had gone to bathe in the river near Lakshman Jhoola, they added. Suddenly, water levels rose and he was swept away by the strong currents, police said.

90.title: Number of transgender voters rise in Thane municipal polls
90.article_body: The number of transgender voters registered with the Thane Municipal Corporation has increased by over six-times, according to data released by the civic body. In 2017, there were 15 transgender voters, which has now increased to 108. The Thane civic polls will be held later this year. Overall, 13.9 lakh ballots are expected to be cast.

91.title: Norwegian oil and gas workers go on strike amid gas shortage
91.article_body: Amid the shortage of Russian gas in Europe due to the conflict in Ukraine, Norwegian oil and gas workers went on a strike on Tuesday, the Lederne union confirmed. Workers are demanding pay raise to compensate for rising inflation. Norway's largest gas producer, Equinor, on Tuesday confirmed it had initiated a shutdown of three oil fields due to the strike.

92.title: UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak resigns citing Boris Johnson's leadership
92.article_body: The UK's Finance Minister Rishi Sunak, along with Health Secretary Sajid Javid, tendered his resignation on Tuesday, citing Prime Minister Boris Johnson's leadership. "I recognise this may be my last ministerial job, but I believe these standards are worth fighting for," Sunak said. Meanwhile, Javid said that he can no longer continue to serve his role in good conscience.

93.title: I'm not admitted to hospital, I'm fine: Shruti on rumours about her health
93.article_body: Actress Shruti Haasan shared a video on Instagram, dismissing all speculations regarding her health issues with PCOS. She said, "Just wanted to clarify...I am [not] unwell...I've realised..some media outlets have blown it way out of proportion." "I also got calls today asking if I am admitted to the hospital, which I am clearly not. I'm doing perfectly fine," she added.

94.title: CAA will be implemented before 2024 Lok Sabha polls: WB BJP chief
94.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar on Tuesday said that the Citizenship (Amendment) Act or CAA will be implemented before the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "BJP has a track record of keeping its promises," Sukanta Majumdar said. "We had promised to build Ram Mandir, we have done it. CAA is our goal and we will achieve it," he added.

95.title: Autorickshaw outpaced Mercedes car: Maha CM Shinde on Uddhav
95.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday took a jibe at Shiv Sena president Uddhav Thackeray and said that an autorickshaw has outpaced a Mercedes car. Shinde, whose rebellion led to the downfall of the MVA government in Maharashtra, was referred to as an "autorickshaw driver" by some Sena leaders when he was leading the revolt.

96.title: Israel PM to convey country's stance on Iran nuclear talks to France
96.article_body: Israeli PM Yair Lapid on Tuesday left for France where he said he will convey Israel's position regarding the current nuclear talks, between Iran and world powers, to the French President. "It's important our voice be heard...against this dangerous deal," Lapid told reporters. "We don't oppose a deal. We seek a very strong deal," an aide of Lapid said.

97.title: It bothers me, I don't like injustice: David Warner's wife on his lifetime leadership ban
97.article_body: Australia opener David Warner's wife Candice Warner said the lifetime leadership ban imposed on her husband by Cricket Australia for his role in ball-tampering scandal still bothers her. "I don't like injustice...so it does bother me," she stated. Candice stated, "It doesn't really bother him because he can go and captain in UAE, he can go and captain in India."

98.title: Russian lower house passes bills on war economy measures
98.article_body: Amid the conflict in Ukraine, the Russian parliament's lower house on Tuesday passed two bills, one of which would allow the government to compel businesses to provide goods to the military. The second bill would authorise the government to regulate working hours in such companies. Workers could be compelled to work at night, on weekends, and without annual leave.

99.title: Vote against annual reporting on harassment: Tesla Board to shareholders
99.article_body: Tesla's Board of Directors has recommended shareholders to vote against a proposal regarding annual reporting on anti-harassment and discrimination efforts taken by the company for its employees, as per a US SEC filing. The Board's existing policies "effectively address" the issues, the document said. Tesla is facing 10 lawsuits alleging racial discrimination or sexual harassment in the US.

100.title: Haryana has become stronghold of criminals: Cong's Hooda
100.article_body: The law and order situation in Haryana has completely collapsed under the BJP-JJP government and the state has become a stronghold of criminals, Congress leader Bhupinder Singh Hooda said on Tuesday. No one is safe in the state, neither the common man nor an MLA, he said. He added that three MLAs have received threats within a week.

101.title: Rihanna becomes youngest self-made billionaire woman in US at 34
101.article_body: Rihanna has become the youngest self-made billionaire woman in US, as per Forbes. The 34-year-old has a net worth of $1.4 billion. She was ranked 21st overall in 'America's Richest Self-Made Women' list and is the only billionaire under 40 on the list. After Rihanna, the next-youngest billionaire on Forbes' list is 41-year-old Kim Kardashian, with $1.8 billion net worth.

102.title: What multiple records were broken during England-India Edgbaston Test?
102.article_body: England recorded their highest-ever successful Test chase (378 runs) against India in Edgbaston Test. Rishabh Pant scored most runs in an overseas Test by an India wicketkeeper (203). Stuart Broad set the record for conceding most runs in an over in a Test (35), while Jasprit Bumrah scored the most runs in an over in a Test (29).

103.title: Joe Root's 'pinky finger' celebration after smashing his 28th Test hundred goes viral
103.article_body: A video of former England captain Joe Root's 'pinky finger' celebration after smashing his 28th hundred in Test cricket has gone viral. After reaching the three-figure mark against India in England's second innings in the Edgbaston Test, Root was seen pointing his pinky finger towards the England dressing room. Root has now hit nine Test tons against India.

104.title: Delhi Police starts registering Kanwariyas ahead of Kanwar Yatra
104.article_body: Delhi Police has started the registration of the Kanwariyas who are going to take part in the Kanwar Yatra. The registration process, which began on July 5, will help in making the yatra safe and easy for the Kanwariyas and enable authorities to provide quick aid, the police said. The Kanwar Yatra is scheduled to begin on July 14.

105.title: 8 injured in mass shooting at a park in US' Minneapolis
105.article_body: Eight people were injured in a mass shooting at Boom Island Park in US' Minneapolis during unofficial American Independence Day celebrations on Monday, according to officials. "We were just watching fireworks and we just heard a whole bunch of shots," a witness said. No immediate arrest was made after the shooting incident, according to the police.

106.title: Negotiations with IMF for bailout are complicated, says Sri Lanka PM
106.article_body: Sri Lanka's talks with the International Monetary Fund for a bailout package are complicated as it is a bankrupt nation, said Prime Minister Ranil Wickremesinghe. Sri Lanka is currently experiencing its worst economic crisis, with massive shortage of essential goods and its foreign exchange levels falling drastically. Citizens have hit the streets to protest against the government.

107.title: Indonesian school helps deaf students recite Quran in sign language
107.article_body: A school in Indonesia's Yogyakarta is teaching students with hearing impairments how to recite the Quran in sign language. The Darul A'shom school, which opened in 2019, has 12 staff members and 115 students aged 7-28 years. Only three out of 10 children with disabilities in Indonesia are able to go to school, a UNICEF survey has shown.

108.title: I don't have the guts to get a cosmetic surgery done: Alaya F
108.article_body: During an Ask Me Anything session on Instagram, actress Alaya F was asked whether she has done any cosmetic surgery. To which, she responded, "No, I haven't. Nothing at all. I've thought about it but I've realised...I don't have the guts. I think I'll thank myself later on if I don't." "I don't think I ever will," she added.

109.title: I hope Shamshera gives me the wings to fly high: Director Karan Malhotra
109.article_body: Speaking about his film 'Shamshera', director Karan Malhotra said, "Hopefully, Shamshera gives me the wings to fly and fly high." "I hope, I get the opportunity to do these films. Nobody can predict the future and for every filmmaker, it's about falling in love with that one idea, which can be anything. Right now, I'm enjoying this space," he added.

110.title: Huge scam in Dalit Bandhu beneficiaries' selection: T'gana Cong MP
110.article_body: Telangana Congress MP N Uttam Kumar Reddy on Tuesday alleged a huge scam in the Dalit Bandhu scheme and demanded a probe. "More than poor Dalits, the scheme is proving to be an income scheme for TRS leaders," Reddy said. He said many Dalit families were being forced to pay commission for their selection as a beneficiary of the scheme.

111.title: Tamil Nadu waiting for an 'Eknath Shinde' to emerge: BJP's Annamalai
111.article_body: After rebel Shiv Sena leader Eknath Shinde-led new government was formed in Maharashtra, BJP's Tamil Nadu President K Annamalai said that Tamil Nadu is also waiting for an 'Eknath Shinde' to emerge. "Just like how...Eknath Shinde sprung up in...Shiv Sena, Tamil Nadu Cabinet headed by DMK leader MK Stalin is also...waiting for an Eknath Shinde to emerge," he said.

112.title: 3 given life term for abduction and murder of 14-yr-old in Punjab
112.article_body: The district court in Punjab's Kapurthala on Monday awarded life imprisonment to three individuals for the kidnapping and murder of a 14-year-old boy in 2016. One of the convicts is a cousin of the deceased victim, the prosecution informed. The convicts had conspired to demand a ransom of ₹30 lakhs from the boy's father, a local industrialist, the prosecution added.

113.title: Navy's INS Satpura participates in 'Rim of the Pacific' exercise
113.article_body: Indian Navy's frigate INS Satpura and a P8I aircraft are participating in this year's 'Rim of the Pacific' naval exercise, known as the largest international maritime warfare exercise. After conclusion of the ongoing harbour phase of the exercise, the sea phase will commence on July 12. Navies of 26 countries are participating in this year's exercise.

114.title: 6-year-old falls into water-filled lift duct in Maharashtra, dies
114.article_body: A six-year-old boy died after falling into a water-filled lift duct in Maharashtra, a police official said. The boy, Vedant Jadhav, had gone missing at 11:30 am and an investigation found him in the lift duct which was in an under-construction building in Thane's Dombivali area. Jadhav had gone to retrieve his ball that he was playing with.

115.title: Turkey's annual inflation at 78.62%; highest in 24 years
115.article_body: Turkey's annual inflation was 78.62% at the end of June - the highest rate in over two decades, according to data released by Turkish Statistical Institute. Consumer prices increased by 4.95% on a monthly comparison. The worst hit sectors were transportation, food and beverage where annual prices surged by 123.37% and 93.93% respectively. Critics blame government policies for the situation.

116.title: Madhavan shares AR Rahman's reaction to Rocketry, says 'Unforgettable moments'
116.article_body: Actor-filmmaker Madhavan shared a video from the premiere of his directorial debut 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' at the Cannes Film Festival. In the video, AR Rahman praised Madhavan as a director. "What a direction. Every dialogue was great," Rahman could be heard telling Madhavan. Reacting to his appreciation, Madhavan tweeted, "Unforgettable moments of my life...@arrahman sir...Thank you."

117.title: I hope Tesla doesn't need to enter mining industry: Elon Musk
117.article_body: Elon Musk said he hopes that Tesla does not need to enter the mining industry owing to its limitations. Speaking on the Getting Stoned podcast, Musk took the example of lithium and said that to make lithium-ion batteries, the refining process to achieve lithium's purity can be a chokepoint. Tesla would rather focus its talent on sustainability transition, Musk added.

118.title: Mamata's security increased; police at secretariat can't use phone
118.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's security has been increased days after a man sneaked into her residence despite presence of a large number of police personnel. The state government has also decided that police personnel posted at the state secretariat can't use mobile phones during duty hours. The police personnel will have to deposit their mobile phones before joining duty.

119.title: Tata Motors' disqualification from BEST's bid upheld by Bombay HC
119.article_body: The Bombay HC upheld the Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport Undertaking's (BEST Undertaking) decision to disqualify Tata Motors from a tender bid for supplying 1,400 e-buses. It said BEST was right to disqualify Tata Motors for being "technically unresponsive". However, it also held the winning bidder, Evey Trans, as "non-responsive" and directed BEST to call for fresh bids, if required.

120.title: Djokovic registers 215-minute 5-set comeback win, reaches his 11th Wimbledon semis
120.article_body: Six-time Wimbledon champion Novak Djokovic registered a comeback victory after losing first two sets against Italian tennis player Jannik Sinner in the Wimbledon 2022 men's singles quarter-finals. Djokovic won the match with a scoreline of 5-7, 2-6, 6-3, 6-2, 6-2 in 215 minutes. With this, Djokovic entered the Wimbledon semi-finals for the 11th time in his career.

121.title: 'Startup founder' most searched keyword on Shaadi.com, not IAS or IPS: MoS IT
121.article_body: Minister of State (MoS) for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar at a recent event said he has been informed by reliable sources that the most searched keyword on Shaadi.com now is 'startup employee' or 'startup founder'. "It's not IAS, not IPS...not Tata company or Birla company," he added. "What better judge of what is a successful career than Shaadi.com," Chandrasekhar further said.

122.title: Nepotism will always be there in the film industry: Rajkummar Rao
122.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has stated that nepotism will always be there in the film industry, adding that your work and talent will speak. He further said that he has friends who were his classmates but are getting recognition now because of OTT platforms. "Jaideep (Ahlawat) who did so well in 'Paatal Lok' and Pratik (Gandhi) in 'Scam 1992'," Rajkummar added.

123.title: 3 people burn to death after collision between trucks in Jodhpur
123.article_body: Three people were burnt to death after a head-on collision between two trucks in Jodhpur's Shergarh area during late hours of Monday, police said on Tuesday. The collision triggered a fire in the fuel tank of one of the trucks, they added. The drivers of the trucks and an assistant were killed after getting trapped in the fire, police informed.

124.title: I express my deep regret: Kerala minister on anti-Constitution remarks
124.article_body: Kerala minister Saji Cherian on Tuesday expressed "deep regret" for his controversial statements criticising the Constitution, saying his remarks were "misinterpreted". "I respect our Constitution...The news that I criticised the Constitution is twisted," he added. Earlier today, Cherian had said that the Indian Constitution was written in a way that can be used to "exploit" people.

125.title: I'm not afraid of failing: Bairstow after twin tons vs India in 5th Test
125.article_body: After scoring 106 and 114* in England's seven-wicket win against India in rescheduled fifth Test, England batter Jonny Bairstow said he's not afraid of failing. "I just have an enjoyment factor now...just want to put pressure on the opposition," he added. Chasing 378, Bairstow and Joe Root added 269-run partnership for fourth wicket. Bairstow was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

126.title: Trying to rewrite how Test cricket is played in Eng: Stokes on 5th Test win
126.article_body: After England levelled the five-match series 2-2 with a seven-wicket win over India, England captain Ben Stokes said, "When the lads play like this, it makes my job easier." He added, "When you have clarity like we have in the dressing room, it makes chasing totals like this [378] easier...we're trying to rewrite how Test cricket is played in England."

127.title: No praise high enough for these two: Jaffer on Bairstow and Root
127.article_body: Praising Joe Root(142*) and Jonny Bairstow(106, 114*) following their centuries in the rescheduled fifth Test against India, Wasim Jaffer tweeted, "No praise high enough for these two! Root is the best test batter right now, but the way Bairstow rose to the challenge in both innings was superb. You just got to doff your hat and say well played."

128.title: OPS seeks Jaishankar's aid for rescue of 12 Indian fishermen
128.article_body: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) leader O Panneerselvam has requested the aid of External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar for release of 12 Indian fishermen captured by the Sri Lankan Navy. The Sri Lankan Navy arrested the fisherfolk for allegedly fishing in the country's territorial waters. Of the arrested fishermen, seven are from Tamil Nadu and five from Puducherry.

129.title: Bomb blast kills 2 UN peacekeepers, injures 5 others in Mali
129.article_body: Two United Nations peacekeepers were killed and five others severely wounded after a convoy was hit by an improvised explosive device in Mali on Tuesday, the UN peacekeeping mission, MINUSMA, said. A rapid intervention force was sent to the scene and the injured were evacuated, it added. The attack may constitute a war crime under international law, it further said.

130.title: Haryana to provide free health facilities to HIV positive patients
130.article_body: Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar has approved a proposal to provide free health facilities such as radiological and laboratory tests to HIV positive patients. The free health facilities are being provided under the Public Private Partnership mode, which currently includes seven categories. Currently, around 22,000 HIV patients in the state are taking Antiretroviral Therapy (ART).

131.title: European Parliament passes two laws to regulate Big Tech dominance
131.article_body: The European Parliament has passed the Digital Markets Act (DMA) and the Digital Services Act (DSA) which will help control the dominance of companies such as Apple, Amazon, Facebook, Google and Microsoft. While the DMA targets monopolisation in the digital markets, the DSA bans targeted advertising aimed at children or based on sensitive data. Companies will face fines for violations.

132.title: BJP could sense growing discontent among Sena MLAs: Fadnavis
132.article_body: Deputy CM of Maharashtra Devendra Fadnavis asserted that BJP could sense the growing discontent among the Shiv Sena legislators for the last three to four months. "They were reeling under a lack of leadership. So, we waited for the opportunity and then made our masterstroke," he said. Maharashtra will see new heights of prosperity under CM Eknath Shinde, he added.

133.title: Govt releases list of states/UTs best in implementing National Food Security Act
133.article_body: Centre released the first State Ranking Index for implementation of National Food Security Act, with Odisha, UP and Andhra Pradesh topping the General Category states/UTs. Among the Special Category states/UTs, Tripura stood first, followed by Himachal Pradesh and Sikkim. They were judged on three points- coverage, targeting and provisions of the Act; delivery platform; and nutrition initiatives.

134.title: I never backed any film or mentioned smoking: Mahua on remarks over Goddess Kali
134.article_body: TMC MP Mahua Moitra clarified her remark about Goddess Kali, wherein she said, "To me, Kali is a meat-eating and alcohol-accepting Goddess." "I never backed any...film...or poster or mentioned...smoking. Suggest you visit...Maa Kali in Tarapith to see what food & drink is offered as bhog," she tweeted. This comes amid controversy over poster of 'Kaali', which shows the Goddess smoking.

135.title: Vaani is so focused, I'd try to distract her on 'Shamshera' set: Ranbir
135.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor called his 'Shamshera' co-star Vaani Kapoor a very fine actor, adding that she is so focused that she is always wearing headphones on set and trying to be in character. "Many times I've tried to distract her and just have [a] stupid conversation," the actor added. He further said that the two have really befriended each other.

136.title: Man who intruded into CM Mamata's house carried iron rod: Police
136.article_body: The man who intruded into West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's residence had carried an iron rod with him, the police said on Tuesday. The rod was hidden under the man's shirt, but it fell on the ground during his escape attempt, an officer said. "We are questioning him to know the purpose of carrying it with him," the officer added.

137.title: Wanted to be contestant on 'Jhalak...' but was told I'm not famous: Maniesh
137.article_body: Host-actor Maniesh Paul has revealed that he had initially wanted to appear as a contestant on dance reality show 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa' but was told he doesn't have a famous enough face. Maniesh was later asked to host the show. "I signed [the contract]...I didn't even read it and that again became a turning point," he added.

138.title: US has so far witnessed 309 mass shootings in 2022: Report
138.article_body: US has so far witnessed 309 mass shootings and 15 mass killings in 2022, according to data by Gun Violence Archive (GVA). This comes as at least six people were shot dead and several others left injured during Independence Day Parade in Illinois. As per GVA data, 10,072 people have died due to firearms so far in US this year.

139.title: Katariya's 45th-min goal helps India hold China to a 1-1 draw in women's hockey WC 2022
139.article_body: India held China to a 1-1 draw on Tuesday to register their second straight draw in the women's hockey World Cup 2022. Jiali Zheng opened the scoring for China in the 26th minute with a field goal, before India's Vandana Katariya equalised in the 45th minute with a penalty corner. India are currently second on the Pool B points table.

140.title: Someone once told me that I'm too pretty for a role: Prachi Desai
140.article_body: Actress Prachi Desai said someone told her that she's "too pretty" for certain kind of roles. She added, "I said 'thank you' to the director for at least telling me that. I am just happy here that they are not doubting my skill, they don't think I lack anything there." "I...don't know what's the right reaction for that," she said.

141.title: Vijay Kumar Janjua appointed Chief Secretary of Punjab
141.article_body: The Punjab government has appointed Vijay Kumar Janjua as Chief Secretary to the Government of Punjab and in addition, Principal Secretary of the Department of Personnel and Vigilance. Earlier, the position was held by Anirudh Tewari. Tewari has now been posted as the Director General of Mahatma Gandhi State Institute of Public Administration.

142.title: Talks to convert Delhi into full UT, move will face resistance: Kejriwal
142.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday alleged that the Centre might dissolve the Delhi Assembly and convert the city into a full Union Territory, adding that the move will face stiff resistance from residents. "They (BJP) fear the AAP and that is why they do not want elections. Kejriwal will keep coming and going, Kejriwal is not important," he said.

143.title: Turkey should play by the rules: Greek Defence Minister
143.article_body: Greek Defence Minister Nikolaos Panagiotopoulos on Tuesday said that Greece "would like to be able to engage with Turkey but Turkey has to play by the rules". "Turkey should not be playing by its own rules, especially rules like the rule of military might and unilateral actions," he added. The two countries have differences over several issues.

144.title: Razorpay shared donor data with police without informing us: Alt News; Razorpay replies
144.article_body: Razorpay has responded after fact-checking website Alt News said that the payments gateway handed over its donor data to the police without informing them. Razorpay said that it received an official written notice from police authorities which it complied with, by sharing the data. "We tried reaching out to the company but did not receive any response," it further said.

145.title: 'Khuda...' makers apologise for hurting religious sentiments with song Haq Hussain
145.article_body: The makers of 'Khuda Haafiz: Chapter II – Agni Pariksha' have issued an apology for hurting religious sentiments of Shia Muslims with song 'Haq Hussain'. The makers have removed the zanjeer blades from the song and changed the lyrics to 'Junoon Hai'. They further clarified that no member of the Shia Muslim community has been presented in a bad light.

146.title: Cong has no right to demand HM's resignation over PSI scam: K'taka CM
146.article_body: Criticising Congress for demanding Karnataka Home Minister Araga Jnanendra's resignation over his alleged involvement in the Police Sub-Inspector recruitment scam, CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday said the opposition party has no "moral right". It is only because of Jnanendra's honesty and efficiency that irregularities were exposed during the preliminary investigation, the CM added.

147.title: Action to be taken if posters of film 'Kaali' not removed: MP minister
147.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra on Tuesday said strict action will be taken if posters of the documentary 'Kaali', showing the goddess smoking a cigarette, are not removed. He said goddess Kaali's "insult" will not be tolerated. "We will also think about getting this film banned in Madhya Pradesh," he added.

148.title: Fan makes Dinesh Karthik's portrait with 600 Rubik's Cubes, video goes viral
148.article_body: A video of a fan making cricketer Dinesh Karthik's portrait with 600 Rubik's Cubes has gone viral on social media. Karthik also responded to the fan's video, writing, "Very nice work Prithvi...Highly impressive." Meanwhile, a Twitter user commented, "Unreal. Simply superb. Great form of Art. Keep it going." Karthik recently made his comeback to Team India.

149.title: India may not depend on imported urea after 2023–24: Mandaviya
149.article_body: Union Minister for Chemicals and Fertilisers Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said, "By 2025, through eight urea plants, India will produce 44 crore Nano Urea Bottles per annum which will be equivalent to 200 LMT...conventional urea." With this, import of urea may not be required in India after 2023-24 and the government will save ₹40,000 crore approximately per annum, he added.

150.title: Emirates plane flies for 14 hours from Dubai to Australia with large hole on its side
150.article_body: An Emirates flight from Dubai to Brisbane flew for around 14 hours with a large hole on its side. The airline said it was created when one of the tyres burst shortly after take-off. "At no point did it have...impact on...fuselage, frame or structure of...aircraft," Emirates stated. No passengers were injured and the flight was able to complete its journey.

151.title: My middle-class roots keep me grounded: Kartik on 'Bhool...' success
151.article_body: Speaking about being level-headed amid success, actor Kartik Aaryan said that his middle-class roots keep him grounded. The actor added he will always be "this guy from Gwalior" who had dreams and ambitions to chase. Kartik further said even if things around him change, he will fundamentally not change at all. His 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' has grossed ₹230 crore worldwide.

152.title: 16-yr-old Indian-origin boy stabbed to death in UK, 3 people charged
152.article_body: A man and two teenagers have been charged with the murder of a 16-year-old Indian-origin boy who was allegedly stabbed to death in UK's Wolverhampton on June 29. The victim, identified as Ronan Kanda, died at the scene after being stabbed twice, post-mortem report revealed. "Detectives are keen to hear from anyone...who may have captured dashcam footage of...attack," police said.

153.title: 34-year-old mother-of-two Maria reaches first Grand Slam semis at Wimbledon
153.article_body: World number 103 Tatjana Maria came from 2-4 down in the final set to beat fellow German Jule Niemeier 4-6, 6-2, 7-5 to reach her maiden Grand Slam semi-final at Wimbledon on Tuesday. The 34-year-old mother of two won the quarter-final match in two hours 18 minutes. "I've goosebumps everywhere. It was such a tough match against Jule," said Maria.

154.title: It was my proposal to make Eknath Shinde Maha CM: Devendra Fadnavis
154.article_body: BJP leader and Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday said, "It was my proposal to make Eknath Shinde the CM..but senior party leaders insisted that government won't run if I stayed out of it, so I accepted the Deputy CM post on their command." He added that it is his responsibility to ensure that Shinde is a successful CM.

155.title: Israelis are lucky to have Yair Lapid as PM: French Prez Macron
155.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron on Tuesday said that the people of Israel are lucky to have Yair Lapid as the new Prime Minister. Macron made the comment ahead of a meeting with the Israeli leader in Paris. Notably, it is the first overseas trip by Lapid since he took over as the caretaker PM last week.

156.title: Balancing emotion, humour without crossing line difficult: 'JugJugg...' director
156.article_body: 'JugJugg Jeeyo' director Raj Mehta has said that trying to balance emotion and humour is creatively very difficult, adding they had to make sure the line is not crossed. "It's gratifying to see the reaction [to the film]," he said. Raj added that it's a family film and they had enough sensibility to understand the difference between right and wrong.

157.title: Experts to visit K'taka districts to look into back-to-back tremors
157.article_body: A team of experts from Hyderabad-based CSIR-National Geophysical Research Institute will soon visit Kodagu and Dakshina Kannada districts in Karnataka to look into back-to-back earthquakes in the two districts. "The district administrations in the two districts have already instructed officials to continuously monitor the situation," Karnataka Revenue Minister R Ashoka said.

158.title: IAS officer arrested for sexually harassing IIT student after a party in Jharkhand
158.article_body: Sub-Divisional Officer of Khunti Sayyed Riyaj Ahemed was arrested on Monday for allegedly sexually harassing an IIT student in Jharkhand, police said. The 2019-batch IAS officer allegedly harassed the girl after attending dinner party hosted at the Deputy Development Commissioner's residence. Prima facie, the allegation was found to be true after Ahemed and guests were questioned, police said.

159.title: Karan Johar donates ₹11 lakh for Assam flood relief, CM thanks him
159.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar donated ₹11 lakh for flood relief to the Assam Chief Minister's Relief Fund on Tuesday. Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma shared the news on Twitter, writing, "Grateful to...Karan Johar and Dharma Productions for contributing ₹11 lakh to CM Relief Fund." Biswa also thanked filmmaker Rohit Shetty for his initiative of getting the film industry together for Assam.

160.title: Don't know what went wrong: Dhaakad producer on film's failure at box office
160.article_body: Speaking about the failure of film Dhaakad, producer Deepak Mukut said, "I don't know what went wrong but I would like to believe that it's people's choice, what they accept and what they not and what they want to watch as well." "But according to us, we feel proud to have made a good, female-led spy action thriller," he added.

161.title: Ex-H'yana CM Chautala moves HC challenging sentencing by trial court
161.article_body: Ex-Haryana CM Om Prakash Chautala has moved to the Delhi High Court, challenging a trial court's order which sentenced him to four years imprisonment in a disproportionate assets case. Chautala's Advocate Harsh Sharma has confirmed the move. The trial court had also imposed a ₹50 lakh fine on Chautala and ordered the confiscation of his four properties in the order.

162.title: Pics show waterlogging in Mumbai after heavy rain
162.article_body: Heavy rainfall in Mumbai and its suburbs on Monday night and Tuesday morning left several parts of the city waterlogged, leading to disruption of traffic movement. Officials said local train services were affected mainly on Central Railway's main and harbour corridors due to waterlogging on tracks. The IMD has issued an orange alert in the city till July 8.

163.title: Could have become CM had I requested: Maharashtra Deputy CM Fadnavis
163.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis on Tuesday said he could have become the Chief Minister of the state had he requested. "We made Shiv Sena (leader) CM for ideology," he said. Fadnavis added, "It was my proposal to make Eknath Shinde CM, but senior party leaders said the government won't run if I stayed out."

164.title: Uddhav Thackeray, Sanjay Raut not accepting reality: Kirit Somaiya
164.article_body: As Shiv Sena's Uddhav Thackeray and Sanjay Raut continued to criticise the newly-elected Eknath Shinde-led government, BJP leader Kirit Somaiya condemned them, saying they are not accepting the reality. "Thackeray needs to introspect now. Raut is accusing BJP of betraying them, rather he betrayed us by taking votes in the name of PM Modi in the 2019 elections," Somaiya said.

165.title: Keanu Reeves answers fan's 'rapid fire' questions at US airport
165.article_body: Actor Keanu Reeves, who recently travelled from London to New York, replied to the "rapid-fire" questions of a fan after landing in US. Television producer Andrew Kimmel shared the encounter on Twitter which is going viral. The fan asked Keanu for an autograph and asked questions like where he is staying and what he will do which Keanu "happily" answered.

166.title: Confident that Murmu will comfortably win Prez elections: Bihar CM
166.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Tuesday said he is confident that NDA's Presidential candidate Droupadi Murmu will comfortably win the election. "It's a matter of happiness that a tribal woman is running for the highest constitutional position of the country," Nitish Kumar said. Droupadi Murmu, who visited Patna, met NDA leaders and sought their support for the upcoming Presidential elections.

167.title: HC judge threatened for exposing BJP's corrupt govt in K'taka: Rahul
167.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday criticised the BJP government for threatening an HC judge with transfer for exposing the party's corrupt government in Karnataka. "Institution after institution is being bulldozed by the BJP. Each of us must stand with those fearlessly doing their duty," Gandhi said, using the hashtag #DaroMat.

168.title: Regularisation of pourakarmikas' services has begun: K'taka CM
168.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Tuesday announced that regularisation of pourakarmikas' services has begun in the state. The pourakarmikas, who were protesting since July 1 demanding regularisation of their services, called off their protest and welcomed the government's decision. "Realising their plight, I had announced ₹2000 monthly hardship allowance for them in the budget," Bommai said.

169.title: Will present debt restructuring programme to IMF by Aug: Sri Lanka PM
169.article_body: Amid ongoing economic crisis, Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe told the parliament on Tuesday that the country will present a debt restructuring programme to the International Monetary Fund (IMF) by August to seek a bailout package. He added that negotiating with IMF is more challenging than earlier due to the nation's bankruptcy. Sri Lanka's total foreign debt is $51 billion.

170.title: I cried when Alia Bhatt told me she was having a baby: Karan Johar
170.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar revealed that he cried when actress Alia Bhatt told him that she was having a baby. "My first emotion was that tears just came out and she came and gave me a hug," he added. Karan further said it's like his baby is having a baby and he can't wait to hold her child in his arms.

171.title: Bombay HC refuses to grant relief to woman alleging forced marriage
171.article_body: The Bombay HC has refused to annul the marriage of a 33-year-old woman, who claimed that she was forced to marry the man and was tortured by him since she was 14 years old. A division bench of Justices KR Shriram and PK Chavan said that the evidence provided by the woman was "improbable, unbelievable and unacceptable".

172.title: Zimbabwe to introduce gold coins amid high inflation rate
172.article_body: The Reserve Bank of Zimbabwe said it will introduce gold coins as a store of value to control the inflation rate that has considerably weakened the local currency. The Governor of the bank said that the gold coins will be called 'Mosi-oa-tunya'. The term, inspired by Victoria falls, means the smoke that thunders.

173.title: HDFC-HDFC Bank merger gets 'no objection' letter from RBI
173.article_body: HDFC Bank on Monday said it has received the Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) approval for its potential merger with its parent company HDFC. "The RBI has accorded its 'no objection' for the scheme...subject to certain conditions," it stated. The merger, which received approval from BSE and NSE last week, remains subject to approvals from the CCI and the NCLT.

174.title: Tiger Shroff's mother shares pics showing his grandfather who fought in WWII at 18
174.article_body: Actor Tiger Shroff's mother, Ayesha Shroff, on Tuesday shared pictures of her father who fought in World War II. "Tiger's grandfather training to fly Tiger Moths. I guess he was around 18 or 19...when he fought in World War II," she wrote. "Decorated for his bravery by his India. I'm proud to be his daughter. Jai Hind," Ayesha added.
