Data said that Himachal records an average of three deaths per day and around 3,000 people lose their lives in road mishaps in Himachal Pradesh annually.

349.title: Life is definitely easier in the commentary box: Ravi Shastri
349.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri, who's currently commentating in the ongoing rescheduled fifth Test between India and England, has said life is "definitely easier in the commentary box". Shastri, however, also added, "To be honest, I have been richer by the experience (India coaching stint). The seven-year stint has been a huge experience for me."

350.title: Nearly 1,000 unknown microbes found trapped in Tibetan glaciers
350.article_body: Scientists have discovered nearly 1,000 new species of microbes in the frozen Tibetan Plateau. Almost 98% of these 968 bacteria species are yet unknown to science, some being over 15,000 years old. The study stated that when the glaciers melt, these microorganisms, possibly carrying novel virulence factors, could lead to local epidemics or pandemics in India and China.

351.title: Landslide in Mumbai's Ghatkopar area due to heavy rain, house damaged
351.article_body: A landslide incident was reported on Tuesday morning in Mumbai's Ghatkopar area in which a house was badly damaged amidst incessant rainfall in the city. However, no casualties have been reported in the incident so far. In the last 12 hours, Mumbai has recorded 95.81 mm of rain due to which areas are waterlogged and traffic movement has been affected.

352.title: India spread the field too soon, were almost fearful: Vaughan on Day 4
352.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said India spread the field "too soon" on Day four of the fifth Test against England, adding that they were almost "fearful". "Once you spread the field, your good balls are going for singles," stated Vaughan. England need 119 runs to win the fifth Test with seven wickets in hand after being given a 378-run target.

353.title: China rejects NASA allegation that it is trying to take over moon
353.article_body: China rejected NASA chief Bill Nelson's allegation that it is trying to take over the moon. This comes after Nelson said, "We must be very concerned that China is landing on the moon and saying: 'It's ours now and you stay out'." A Chinese government spokesperson said the US has "constantly constructed a smear campaign against China's…reasonable outer space endeavours".

354.title: Pic of England fan making racist gestures towards Indian fans in stands surfaces
354.article_body: A picture of an England fan making racist gestures towards Indian fans in the stands during the rescheduled fifth England-India Test at Edgbaston has surfaced online. "I witnessed this guy...He was horrific. We had to leave," an England fan tweeted on his picture. The England and Wales Cricket Board (ECB) has launched an investigation into the matter.

355.title: Why should you not be penalised: Govt in notice to Ola Electric, others over EV fires
355.article_body: The Centre has sent notices to Ola Electric, Pure EV and Okinawa asking them to explain why they should not be penalised for the recent electric scooter fires, some of them reportedly caused by battery failures. They have been given time till July-end to respond to the notices. The government has also formed two committees to probe the fire incidents.

356.title: 60-80 people wanted to kill him, 8 attempts made to kill him during polls: Sidhu's father
356.article_body: Balkaur Singh, father of late singer Sidhu Moosewala, has said that gangsters are running a parallel government in Punjab. He also said that 60-80 people were after Moosewala to kill him, adding, "Efforts were made at least eight more times during the elections to kill him." Singh said, "Government too left no stone unturned, withdrew his security, publicised it."

357.title: Robbers inspired by B'wood film pose as CBI, IT officials to raid Delhi house
357.article_body: Inspired by a Bollywood movie, a team of 15 robbers, posing as CBI, IT and anti-corruption branch officials, raided a businessman's house in Delhi's Shahdara on Sunday, police said. They held the family members hostage and seized their cellphones and ransacked the house, police added. The neighbours managed to overpower four robbers when they were trying to flee, police stated.

358.title: I've known Hrithik since I was 10, I love him from bottom of my heart: Zayed
358.article_body: Zayed Khan opened up about his bond with his former brother-in-law Hrithik Roshan and said, "I've known Hrithik since I was 10." He added that Hrithik is "one of the most generous and disciplined people" he has ever met. "I love him from...bottom of my heart...He has always been the kind of brother...I can speak my heart to," said Zayed.

359.title: Indian bowlers tried too hard, there was desperation: Zaheer on Day 4
359.article_body: Ex-India pacer Zaheer Khan said the Indian bowlers went wrong on Day 4 of the fifth Test against England by trying "too hard", adding all of them were bowling with the mindset that they need to go after wickets. "There was desperation...and...they were trying too many things. They kept changing their line and lengths and paid the price," stated Zaheer.

360.title: Spinner's job in 4th innings is to win the game for the team: Swann on Jadeja
360.article_body: Ex-England spinner Graeme Swann has said India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja's job on Day 4 of the ongoing Test against England was not to slow down scoring but to pick wickets. "Your job in the 4th innings, as a spinner, is to win the game for the team...You can't do that, bowling into a foothold without catchers," stated Swann.

361.title: Will work for the party again: Mithun Chakraborty in Kolkata
361.article_body: Actor-turned-politician Mithun Chakraborty announced his comeback in active politics before 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "I was inactive for some time because of health reasons. But I am fit now. So, I came to Kolkata today," he said. "I will work on specific assignments given to me by the party leadership, which I am unable to disclose now," he further added.

362.title: Man says Hyd police called shop number after he forgot to lock it, thanks them
362.article_body: Hyderabad City Police on Tuesday shared a picture of a man's tweet in which he said that patrolling personnel of the Sulthan Bazar Police Station called his shop's number after he forgot to lock it. The man thanked the police for their "patience and service", adding that they "saved" his property. "For you with you always," the police said.

363.title: Bomb hurled at group celebrating b'day in Prayagraj, 3 injured
363.article_body: Three people in a group suffered minor injuries after another group hurled a bomb at them while celebrating a birthday party in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. Police have arrested one person in connection with the case for questioning and suspected some past reason behind the matter. They said that minors are also involved in the case and will be arrested.

364.title: K'taka IT Minister lays foundation for anti-venom research centre in B'luru
364.article_body: Karnataka IT Minister CN Ashwathnarayan laid the foundation for the Anti-Venom Research and Development Centre (AVRDC) in Bengaluru on Monday. The centre, which will begin operations at the Institute of Bioinformatics and Applied Biotechnology (IBAB) in Electronic City, will be built at a cost of ₹7 crore. It would help in lowering snakebite-related fatalities in the nation, the minister said.

365.title: Woman, partner kill her husband in staged road accident in Ahmedabad, arrested
365.article_body: A woman, along with her partner, was arrested for allegedly killing her 43-year-old husband by staging a road accident through contract killing in June in Ahmedabad. The man was hit by a speeding pick-up truck from behind. According to police, the accused paid ₹10 lakh to kill him. Investigation revealed the accused persons were in a relationship, an official said.

366.title: Italian man arrested for trying to enter India without visa
366.article_body: An Italian national was arrested for allegedly trying to enter India without a valid visa through the India-Nepal border in Maharajganj, Uttar Pradesh. The accused, identified as Federico Negri (39), was stopped by the Sashastra Seema Bal (SSB) team for routine checking on Monday but he could not produce a valid visa, an official said.

367.title: Pune police to launch programme to stop youths from engaging in crime
367.article_body: Pune Rural Police will soon launch a programme in a bid to prevent youths from engaging in crime or illegal activities. It's "easy" to file cases and put youths behind bars, "but considering their age and career, we have decided to launch this programme", Additional SP Mitesh Ghatte said. The programme focuses on counselling for school and college students.

368.title: Tiger released in UP's reserve after experts say it poses no threat
368.article_body: A tiger was released in UP's Dudhwa Tiger Reserve on Tuesday after experts found that it posed no threat to humans. The tiger was captured along with a tigress following a series of human-animal conflict cases in the region. On observation, the forest officials found that the tigress was behind the attacks on humans and the tiger displayed no aggression.

369.title: Imran's party apologised to US over foreign conspiracy charge: Pak minister
369.article_body: Pakistan Defence Minister Khawaja Asif has claimed that former PM Imran Khan's party PTI apologised to US diplomat Donald Lu for levelling allegations of foreign conspiracy to topple the previous government. Asif claimed that Khan sent a message to Washington DC that he wanted to "fix things and relationship with the superpower".

370.title: India were very poor with the bat, ball, tactically: Vaughan on Day 4
370.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan said India were "very poor" with the bat, ball and tactically on day four of the fifth Test against England. "They did not realise that...England...have got a different mindset," added Vaughan. Discussing Jasprit Bumrah's captaincy on day four, Kevin Pietersen said, "For half an hour that was pure madness...Bumrah [didn't get his]...tactics right...at all."

371.title: TikTok sued over death of 2 girls who did 'blackout challenge': Report
371.article_body: TikTok has been sued over the death of two young girls in the US who died while trying the "blackout challenge" on the platform,  the Los Angeles Times reported. The lawsuits allege that Lalani Erika Walton, 8, and Arriani Jaileen Arroyo, 9, died after copying the trend. The app's algorithm allegedly recommended videos of the strangulation challenge to the girls.

372.title: 7-year-old girl sexually assaulted in Delhi's Laxmi Nagar
372.article_body: A seven-year-old girl was allegedly sexually assaulted by a stranger in Delhi's Laxmi Nagar area. The victim was playing outside her residence when the accused came and took her to an abandoned place before allegedly assaulting her, police said. Notably, the accused has been zeroed in and efforts are on to arrest him, police added.

373.title: SpiceJet flight from Delhi makes emergency landing in Pakistan
373.article_body: A SpiceJet flight from Delhi to Dubai made an emergency landing in Karachi, Pakistan after developing a technical fault. All passengers on board are safe, news agency ANI reported. Earlier this month, a Delhi-Jabalpur SpiceJet flight returned to the Delhi airport after the crew noticed smoke inside the plane.

374.title: Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' crosses ₹300-crore mark in India
374.article_body: Actor Kamal Haasan's 'Vikram' has crossed the ₹300-crore mark in India. The film, which was released in theatres on June 3, has earned more than ₹400 crore globally. Directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, the action thriller also stars Vijay Sethupathi, Fahadh Faasil and Suriya. 'Vikram' was released in multiple languages, including Hindi, Kannada, Telugu, Malayalam and Tamil.

375.title: Punjab govt appoints Delhi CM Kejriwal's batchmate as officiating DGP
375.article_body: The Bhagwant Mann-led government in Punjab appointed Gaurav Yadav, a 1992-batch IPS officer, as the state's officiating Director General of Police (DGP). Yadav, who is a civil services batchmate of Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, is given this role in addition to his duty as Principal Secretary to Punjab CM's office after DGP VK Bhawra went on two months leave.

376.title: Get me home from Russia: Jailed US basketball player to Biden
376.article_body: American basketball player Brittney Griner, in a handwritten letter, appealed to  US President Joe Biden to get her home from jail in Russia, saying, "I'm terrified I might be here forever."  Griner was detained at a Moscow airport in mid-February for allegedly carrying cannabis vape cartridges. Griner went on trial on Friday. She faces up to 10 years in prison.

377.title: HC stays demolition drive in Patna's Nepali Nagar; DM says already complete
377.article_body: Patna High Court on Monday stayed the demolition drive in the city's Nepali Nagar area. However, the district magistrate said that before the order was received, the drive was already complete and 40-acre government land was cleared of encroachment. "By the time the order came...land was handed over to the housing board. It belongs to the housing board," DM added.

378.title: India's services sector growth hits 11-year high in June
378.article_body: India's services sector grew at the fastest pace in over 11 years in June amid strong demand. The S&P Global India Services Purchasing Managers' Index rose to 59.2 in June from 58.9 in May, its highest since April 2011. As per companies, the growth stemmed from ongoing improvements in demand following the retreat of COVID-19 restrictions and capacity expansion.

379.title: Student shares 'horrible experience' with IndiGo, Scindia says 'Luggage sent to hostel'
379.article_body: A student shared her "horrible experience" with IndiGo, saying she had to travel to four airports in 24 hours and when she finally reached destination, her luggage wasn't delivered. She tweeted, "How much more mental & physical exhaustion am I supposed to suffer?" Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia helped her, saying, "Your luggage has been delivered at hostel gate. Take care."

380.title: Aaditya Thackeray confronts rebel MLA, says 'didn't expect this', video surfaces
380.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray confronted rebel party MLA Prakash Surve for joining Eknath Shinde camp. In a video shared by Times Now, Thackeray can be seen talking to Surve. "I thought you were coming back to us...You were with us...This was not expected of you...There was so much love for you from all of us...I personally...felt bad," Thackeray said.

381.title: Superintendent of police arrested for raping pregnant woman in Punjab
381.article_body: A special investigation team (SIT) of Punjab Police on Monday arrested a superintendent of police for allegedly raping a pregnant woman at his official residence in Gurdaspur. The woman was having a dispute with her husband and in-laws. According to the FIR, the SP named Gurmeet Singh used to send vulgar messages to the victim and had threatened her.

382.title: Neha celebrates 20 yrs of Miss India win, jokes she's 'a few dress sizes bigger'
382.article_body: Neha Dhupia, taking to Instagram, shared a note as she completed 20 years of winning Miss India crown. The actress, who was felicitated by her parents at grand finale of Femina Miss India 2022, wrote, "I didn't think...it'd be possible to wear this crown on stage...again." "20 years later...I stood...stronger, more experienced and a few dress sizes bigger," Neha added.

383.title: No matter which format Shreyas plays, he's going to get bounced: Vaughan
383.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan has said India's Shreyas Iyer has got a "real issue" with short deliveries and he'll have to "iron it out" to continue playing international cricket. "No matter what he plays, T20, ODI or Tests...Shreyas is going to get bounced," stated Vaughan. Shreyas was dismissed off short balls in both innings in the ongoing Test against England.

384.title: Minecraft pays tribute to YouTuber Technoblade who died from cancer
384.article_body: Minecraft has been updated with a tribute to the popular streamer Technoblade who passed away due to stage four cancer, aged 23. The game's tribute to the creator adds a new crowned pig to its splash screen, which was also the creator's YouTube channel icon. Minecraft said it was "heartbroken over the loss of Technoblade".

385.title: Confident of winning 100 seats if mid-term polls held in Maha: Raut
385.article_body: Shiv Sena MP Sanjay Raut said that his party is confident of winning 100 seats if mid-term polls are conducted in Maharashtra. "Shiv Sena is Balasaheb Thackeray's. Cannot be anyone else's. You cannot hijack it through money," Raut added. Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has said that the rebel MLAs were not only given money but also "something else", Raut said.

386.title: Karnataka Cong MLA's offices, houses raided by ACB in Bengaluru
386.article_body: Multiple Bengaluru-based properties linked to Karnataka Congress MLA BZ Zameer Ahmed Khan are being raided by the Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) on Tuesday. Khan was also booked by the ACB in the disproportionate assets case. Raids are being conducted at Khan's two offices and three residences which are located in areas including Sadashiva Nagar, Banashankari, Kalasipalya and Bengaluru Cantonment.

387.title: Pet dog stops robbery bid on ATM containing ₹27 lakh in J'khand
387.article_body: A robbery bid on an ATM on the ground floor of a house in Jharkhand's Hazaribag failed after the house's pet dog began barking and alerted its owner and neighbours, police said on Tuesday. The ATM contained ₹27 lakh, police added. The robbers, who'd arrived with gas cutters, LPG cylinders and hammers, escaped as people woke up, police further said.

388.title: ED raids over 40 locations of Vivo, related firms in money laundering probe
388.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday conducted raids at Chinese smartphone manufacturing company Vivo and related firms, officials said. The raids were carried out at 44 locations across the country under sections of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. Earlier in May, local units of ZTE Corporation and Vivo were investigated for alleged financial irregularities.

389.title: HC grants bail to Shiv Sena MP's associate in money laundering case
389.article_body: Bombay High Court has granted bail to Shiv Sena MP Bhavana Gawali's associate, Saeed Khan, in connection with a money laundering case. Khan was arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in the case in September 2021. Khan was accused of converting a trust, associated with Gawali, into a company and becoming its director for wrongful gains.

390.title: Christian Eriksen likely to join Manchester United
390.article_body: Denmark's Christian Eriksen has reportedly agreed to join Manchester United on a three-year deal after his contract at Brentford ended last month. Eriksen had joined Brentford after Inter Milan terminated his contract due to his cardiac device implant. Eriksen suffered a cardiac arrest during Denmark's game against Finland at the European Championship in June last year.

391.title: Centre should release white paper on employment: T'gana minister
391.article_body: Telangana Finance Minister T Harish Rao on Monday asked Centre to release a white paper on filling two crore jobs every year. "BJP...promised to offer two crore jobs every year and in eight years, 16 crore jobs had to be offered but...central government failed," Rao said. On the other hand, Telangana government has filled about 1.35 lakh posts, he added.

392.title: 70-year-old woman beaten to death by villagers in J'khand over 'witchcraft'
392.article_body: A 70-year-old woman was beaten to death by villagers in Jharkhand’s Garhwa district, as they claimed that the woman practised "witchcraft", police said on Tuesday. In a complaint, the deceased woman’s family alleged that five persons dragged her at least 200 metres from her house on Sunday at around 8:30 pm and beat her to death with sticks.

393.title: Delhi reports 32 dengue cases in June, 143 cases so far in 2022
393.article_body: According to a civic report, Delhi reported 32 dengue cases in June, taking this year's tally to 143. No related deaths have been reported in the national capital until now this year. Moreover, no new cases were reported this month until July 2. Also, Delhi has recorded 27 cases of malaria and eight cases of chikungunya so far in 2022.

394.title: My son Stefan likes to intimidate me on the court: Novak Djokovic
394.article_body: Talking about his son Stefan, Novak Djokovic said, "He likes to intimidate me on the court with finishing the swing here. He knows I don't like that particularly." "Whenever he does that, he always laughs because he knows," added Djokovic. "I try to use every available opportunity...to play with him because Stefan's...fully immersed into tennis," he stated.

395.title: Delhi BJP leader Kapil Mishra claims receiving death threat via email
395.article_body: Delhi BJP leader Kapil Mishra on Monday claimed that he received a death threat through email. In a tweet, Mishra shared a screenshot of the email that read, "Terrorist Kapil Mishra you will not be allowed to live long." Mishra further wrote that he isn't scared of such threats, adding, "Our campaign to help...families of victims of Jihadist violence...will continue...aggressively."

396.title: Razorpay blocks Alt News donation link, restores after 'clarity'
396.article_body: Days after fact-checker Mohammed Zubair's arrest, online payment gateway Razorpay deactivated the donation link for Alt News. However, the company restored it "following clarity on the issue". The company said it had temporarily disabled the account during the preliminary investigation by law enforcement authorities. This comes after Alt News refuted allegations of receiving funds from overseas.

397.title: If I play murderer, does it make me one: Kiara on criticism for 'Kabir..' role
397.article_body: While talking about being criticised for her role in the movie 'Kabir Singh', actress Kiara Advani asked, "If I play a murderer in my next film, does it make me one?" "It's hypocritical to praise actors who otherwise play a grey shade and then criticise them when they play a grey shade of a regular character," she added.

398.title: Ukraine is in talks with Turkey, UN on grain exports: Zelenskyy
398.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Ukraine is holding talks with Turkey and the UN on securing guarantees for grain exports. "This is a very important thing that someone guarantees...security of ships for this or that country, apart from Russia, which we don't trust. We, therefore, need security for those ships which will come here to load foodstuffs," he added.

399.title: We are optimistic about winning Edgbaston Test: Eng's Alex Lees
399.article_body: English opener Alex Lees has said that the England team is "optimistic" about winning the Edgbaston Test and levelling the series against India at 2-2. "If we bat well for the first 30-40 minutes tomorrow (Tuesday) morning, we should be in a pretty strong position...There is an ultimate belief from one to 11 [that] we can do it," Lees said.

400.title: Singapore Prez, Parliament Speaker, Culture Min test +ve for COVID
400.article_body: Singapore President Halimah Yacob, Speaker of Parliament Tan Chuan-Jin, and Culture Minister Edwin Tong have tested for COVID-19. The 67-year-old President, who is vaccinated and boosted, said that she is experiencing mild symptoms of COVID-19. Over the last 28 days, Singapore has reported 1,40,965 coronavirus infections. The country has recorded more than 14 lakh COVID-19 cases so far.

401.title: Microsoft delegation gets 'Peace Prize' from Ukrainian President
401.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to announce that a Microsoft delegation has been awarded 'Peace Prize' from the President of Ukraine Volodymyr Zelenskyy. "We are grateful to have you on the light side of digital. Microsoft stands for truth and for peace," Fedorov said. Earlier, Microsoft took several actions in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

402.title: Filmmaker Quentin Tarantino, wife Daniella blessed with a baby girl
402.article_body: Filmmaker Quentin Tarantino and his wife, model Daniella, have been blessed with their second child, a baby girl. The 59-year-old director and his 38-year-old wife had announced in February that they are expecting their second child. Their first child, son Leo, was born in February 2020. Tarantino and Daniella got married in November 2018.
